sentence.text: ﻿Case 2 is a 2-year-old child who presented with facial dysmorphism with macrocephaly and frontal bossing at birth.
Parameters at birth were normal (weight 3100 g, height 49 cm, HC 35.5 cm); the child was hypotonic and able to sit unaided at 11 months of age.
Facial features included a tall forehead with frontal bossing, hypertelorism, strabismus, short nose, and protruding tongue.

Brain MRI showed a corpus callosum agenesis (figure 2C) as well as parallel and dilated lateral ventricles characteristic of complete callosal agenesis (figure 2F) and a vermis dysgenesis with an MTS (figure 2E) that suggested the diagnosis of ACLS, despite the absence of polydactyly.
Instead, bilateral 2–3 syndactyly was observed in the feet.

Direct sequencing of KIF7 revealed a single T insertion in exon 17, predicting a frameshift and a premature termination of the protein, c.1019dupT, p.Asn341GlnfsX122 inherited from his father and a maternally inherited nonsense mutation in exon 17: c.3331C>T, p.Arg1111X.
